note.p: Education: Christ Church, Oxford (matriculated 1656); Middle Temple (admitted 1669); Gray's Inn (admitted 1675)

Career: Travelled in the Netherlands and France (1660); MP for Tamworth (1669-1679); MP for Yorkshire (1679-1681, 1685-1687); Commissioner for Assessment for West Riding of Yorkshire and York (1673-1680), East Riding (1679-1680), Westminster (1689); Colonel of Militia for West Riding (?1679-1687)
Other RSActivity: Proposed on the same day he was elected and admitted on 13 January 1664.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Foster; GEC; Hunter; Henning
